satellite_technologies.name: Carbon Mapper
satellite_technologies.description: Carbon Mapper is a satellite-based system designed to detect and quantify methane emissions from various sources. It utilizes advanced imaging techniques to provide high-resolution data on methane leaks, enabling targeted interventions.
satellite_technologies.importance: This technology plays a crucial role in monitoring emissions from oil and gas operations, landfills, and agricultural practices, helping to mitigate climate change.

satellite_technologies.name: MethaneSat
satellite_technologies.description: MethaneSat is a dedicated satellite mission aimed at monitoring methane emissions globally. It is equipped with advanced sensors that can detect methane concentrations in the atmosphere with high precision.
satellite_technologies.importance: By providing comprehensive data on methane emissions, MethaneSat supports climate action initiatives and helps governments and organizations track their progress in reducing greenhouse gases.

satellite_technologies.name: GHGSat
satellite_technologies.description: GHGSat operates satellites that monitor greenhouse gas emissions from industrial facilities worldwide. Its technology allows for the detection of methane emissions from space, providing valuable insights into emission sources.
satellite_technologies.importance: GHGSat's data is essential for regulatory compliance and environmental monitoring, enabling industries to reduce their carbon footprint and improve sustainability.

satellite_technologies.name: AVIRIS-NG
satellite_technologies.description: The Airborne Visible/Infrared Imaging Spectrometer - Next Generation (AVIRIS-NG) is an advanced hyperspectral imaging system that captures detailed spectral information across a wide range of wavelengths.
satellite_technologies.importance: AVIRIS-NG is used for research and monitoring of methane emissions, providing critical data for understanding atmospheric processes and the impact of emissions on climate change.
